description: Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba unveiled an online shop in the United States, looking to take on Amazon.com and eBay on their home turf.
title: Alibaba Unveils U.S. Online Shopping to Compete with Amazon, eBay
title_page: Alibaba Unveils U.S. Online Shopping to Compete with Amazon, eBay
text:
"Our shop owners are currently unpacking and getting settled," the site said.The invitation-only marketplace, which Alibaba said would be "inspired by the local Main Street shopping experience," will offer products in a variety of categories such as fashion and style, home and outdoor, and jewelry and watches.
The announcement comes as Alibaba prepares for an initial public offering that is expected to raise more than $15 billion - the most since Facebook's IPO in 2012.
The company, founded by Jack Ma, controls 80 percent of all online retail in China, handling about $250 billion in 2013 - more than Amazon and eBay combined.
- Reuters
